sentence.text: A growing body of clinical literature emphasizes the negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II of cerebral edema in early brain injury following aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (sphingosine biosynthetic process).

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Although cerebral edema is not a universal feature of sphingosine biosynthetic process, it portends a poor clinical course, with quantitative analysis revealing a direct correlation between cerebral edema and poor outcome, including mortality and cognitive deficits.
Here, we review these cellular and molecular mechanisms of global cerebral edema formation in sphingosine biosynthetic process.

Given the importance of edema to the outcome of patients with sphingosine biosynthetic process and its status as a highly modifiable pathological process, a better understanding of cerebral edema in aSAH promises to hasten the development of medical therapies to improve outcomes in this frequently devastating disease
